ACCOMPLICE.Defintion: a person who helps someone else to commit a crime or to do something morally wrong

ACCUSER.Defintion: a person who claims that someone has done something morally wrong, illegal, or unkind

ALCOHOLISM.Defintion: the condition of being an alcoholic, dependent on alcohol

ANATOMICAL.Defintion: relating to the scientific study and representation of the physical body and how its parts are arranged

ARISTOCRAT.Defintion: a class of people who hold high social rank

AT LARGE.Defintion: a person who is at large is not in prison

AWARENESS.Defintion: knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing

BOOM.Defintion: an increase in something, or a time when something becomes more popular

BROTHELS.Defintion: a place where people go and pay to have sex with prostitutes

CIRCULATION.Defintion: the number of people that a newspaper or magazine is regularly sold to

COMMONPLACE.Defintion: happening often or often seen or experienced and so not considered to be special

CONCLUSIVE.Defintion: proving that something is TRUE, or ending any doubt

DETAINED.Defintion: to force someone officially to stay in a place

DISGUST.Defintion: to make someone feel annoyed, upset, or ill about something

ECCENTRIC.Defintion: strange or unusual, sometimes in a humorous way

EMBELLISHED.Defintion: (of a story) made it sound more interesting by adding details that are not true

EVADE.Defintion: to avoid or escape from someone or something

EXTRADITE.Defintion: to make someone return for trial to another country or state where they have been accused of doing something illegal

GET AWAY WITH.Defintion: to succeed in avoiding punishment for something

GRUESOME.Defintion: extremely unpleasant and shocking, and usually dealing with death or injury

HEIGHT.Defintion: the time when a situation or event is strongest or most full of activity

INFLUX.Defintion: the fact of a large number of people or things arriving at the same time

IT'S TELLING.Defintion: showing the truth about a situation or showing what someone really thinks

JAIL.Defintion: a place where criminals are kept to punish them for their crimes, or where people accused of crimes are kept while waiting for their trials

METHODOLOGY.Defintion: a system of ways of doing, teaching, or studying something

NONE THE WISER.Defintion: to be none the wiser also means to not be aware of something

PATROLLED.Defintion: (especially of soldiers or the police) to go around an area or a building to see if there is any trouble or danger

PERSECUTION.Defintion: the treatment of someone unfairly or cruelly over a long period of time because of their race, religion, or political beliefs

PERUSE.Defintion: to read through something, especially in order to find the part you are interested in

POINT THE FINGER.Defintion: to say that someone should be blamed or is guilty of something

POSTED BAIL.Defintion: to pay money, especially so that a person who has been accused of committing a crime can be free until their trial

PREVENTATIVE.Defintion: intended to stop something before it happens

RIFE.Defintion: if something unpleasant is rife, it is very common or happens a lot

SADISTIC.Defintion: a person who gets pleasure, sometimes sexual, by being cruel to or hurting another person

SEIZED UPON.Defintion: to use or bring attention to something for your advantage

SUPPOSED.Defintion: believed by many people to be true, but not proven and often doubted by the person who is speaking or writing

TO NO AVAIL.Defintion: without any success or any effect

TRAUMATIZED.Defintion: severely shocked and upset in a way that causes lasting emotional pain

VICINITY.Defintion: the area around a place or where the speaker is

WIDESPREAD.Defintion: existing or happening in many places and/or among many people
